comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content:
Here is James P. Holland at the same parade. The New York Times says he was the Grand Marshall for the New York City parade. This gentleman is wearing a bow tie, and Holland is not in his labeled photo. Willard Small was the Grand Marshall at the Newark New Jersey parade.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4276170915/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The parade took place on Monday, September 1, 1913. Turnout was low, a result attributed to prosperity, which led many workers to leave town to enjoy a three-day weekend. Here's the story in Tuesday's New York Times: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A05E6DB123FE633A...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Here are James P. Holland and this man in the same photograph. Everybody gets to be a Marshal -----
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4465066868/]
